alert.note: Alert for Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 22 at 10:49AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt is occurring. * WHERE...The Yukon River and Tributaries Draining the Eastern Brooks Range * WHEN...Through Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Water levels are running bankfull and overbank in low lying areas and minor flooding is possible. Some low lying roads in Fort Yukon and Beaver are covered by water. Water is also surrounding the runway in Fort Yukon. Remote cabins and fish camps along along rivers may experience minor flooding and significant bank erosion is likely. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Rapid snowmelt in the Eastern Brooks Range is sending a large volume of water down tributaries feeding the Yukon and Porcupine River. This high water will continue to move down the Porcupine and Yukon River over the next several days. Some locations are seeing higher water than observed during breakup. - Http://weather.gov/aprfc - If you live near or along the Yukon River, Porcupine River, and other tributaries draining the Eastern Brooks Range should move valuables to higher ground, and prepare to move yourself to higher ground at short notice.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
